page.title: 06Employment in Chalton
page.content:
In the past, most inhabitants were farmers or agricultural labourers. Today there are three farmers but because of mechanisation and the number of sons, they employ only six men. Other occupations are: barister, brewery director, naval officer, lecturer, builder, IBM manager and several retired. Few of the wives work. One had been the cookery editress of 'Woman's Weekly'.
The furthest distance travelled by commuters was to London; otherwise people worked at home or travelled an average of 12 miles.
